definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
lit. to support the sky as a single pillar (idiom)/fig. to take a crucial responsibility upon one's shoulders
human flesh search engine/a large-scale collective effort to find details about a person or event (Internet slang)
pinyin: ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3 yin3 qing2

definition: to clasp hands/to put one's palms together (in obeisance)

sentences.english: Old Red-Nosed Gong lifted the bowl of yellow wine in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 紅鼻子老拱手裏擎了一碗黃酒。

sentences.english: The agate lamp within thy hand!
sentences.chinese: 瑪瑙的亮燈擎在你手裏。

sentences.english: When I heard these words, tears filled my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 當我聽到這些話時，眼睛裏擎滿了淚水。

sentences.english: Or the vivid green field holds up the bright blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 還是嫩綠的大地擎拖着蔚藍的天空。

sentences.english: I saw a Syrian who held in his hands a thin rod like a reed.
sentences.chinese: 我見到一個敘利亞人，手裏擎一枝蘆葦般的細杆。

definition: Lianyun district of Lianyungang city 連雲港市|连云港市[Lian2 yun2 gang3 shi4], Jiangsu
Tianmen sub-prefecture level city in Hubei
Ziyun Hmong and Buyei autonomous county in Anshun 安順|安顺[An1 shun4], Guizhou
blood shed in a just cause
